text: Oh, I missed this somehow, <@U01AHL8AGBB>.  I think it works better in the world of SME content where the SMEs aren't professional writers.  I imagine the response to a pro proposing something like that would be, "write better."  :laughing: With reducing time to draft when offering services, that definitely comes with its own incentives.  My business has switched largely to a batch content model for that exact reason -- deliver all of the content ASAP, and the discussion about the next batch starts earlier, and revenue front-loads.

text: Very affordable and great quality work

elements.text: Very affordable and great quality work

text:
Howdy! I'm looking for a freelance content marketer with a technical background, or someone who's well versed in working with engineers, grasping technical details, etc.

My goal is to increase the brand awareness of the software and hardware engineering teams at Culture Biosciences.

To do that I'd like to have someone come in and interview engineers about their projects and help write blog posts for a to-be-created engineering blog. I'd also like to experiment with a work-in-public format on other channels like twitter and/or linkedin (smaller pieces of content, more informal, pictures of the lab, etc).

All of this is in service of driving more inbound software and hardware engineers.

Also if someone knows a bit about content strategy, that would be very helpful as well.

I'm not certain, but I think ~2 pieces of content a month would be a great start (maybe 1k - 1.5k words?)

If this sounds of interest, shoot me a DM.

All of this is in service of driving more inbound software and hardware engineers.

Also if someone knows a bit about content strategy, that would be very helpful as well.
